title: South Africa
tagline: Vibrant cities. Untamed wilderness. Coastal beauty.
description: South Africa is where diversity comes to life. From Cape Town's oceanside charm and wine estates to Big Five safaris in Kruger, this is a land of contrast and deep story.
highlights: Safari in Kruger National Park or private reserves
Cape Town: Table Mountain, Robben Island, beaches
Soweto, Zulu heritage, or Xhosa community experiences

travelPrep.visa: Most visitors need a visa. US, UK, EU, and Canadian citizens can enter visa-free for up to 90 days. Check current requirements as they change frequently.
vaccines: Yellow Fever (required if arriving from endemic areas)
travelPrep.currency: South African Rand (ZAR). Credit cards widely accepted. ATMs available in cities. Tipping 10-15% is customary.
etiquette: Greet with a handshake and maintain eye contact
Use right hand for eating and handshakes

seasons.label: Summer (Dec-Feb)
seasons.summary: Warm to hot, 20-30°C. Best for beach activities and Cape Town. Some afternoon thunderstorms.

seasons.label: Autumn (Mar-May)
seasons.summary: Mild and pleasant, 15-25°C. Ideal for wine regions and outdoor activities. Less crowded.

seasons.label: Winter (Jun-Aug)
seasons.summary: Cool and dry, 10-20°C. Perfect for safari viewing as animals gather around water sources.

seasons.label: Spring (Sep-Nov)
seasons.summary: Warming up, 15-25°C. Great for whale watching and wildflower viewing in the Western Cape.

title: Kenya
tagline: The original safari dream. Wild, bold, and full of story.
description: From the Great Migration in the Maasai Mara to the Swahili coast, Kenya captures Africa's heart through wildlife and cultural depth.
highlights: Safari in the Mara or Amboseli
sampleItinerary: 4 nights on the coast (Lamu or Diani)

travelPrep.visa: Most visitors need an eVisa. Apply online before travel. US, UK, EU citizens can get visa on arrival for tourism. Valid passport required.
travelPrep.currency: Kenyan Shilling (KES). US dollars widely accepted. Credit cards accepted in major hotels and lodges. Cash preferred for local markets.
etiquette: Use right hand for eating and handshakes
Respect wildlife viewing rules and distances
Dress modestly, especially in rural areas

seasons.label: Dry Season (Jun-Oct)
seasons.summary: Cool and dry, 15-25°C. Best for wildlife viewing as animals gather around water sources. Peak safari season.

seasons.label: Short Rains (Nov-Dec)
seasons.summary: Warm with brief showers, 20-28°C. Good for bird watching and fewer crowds. Some roads may be muddy.

seasons.label: Hot Season (Jan-Mar)
seasons.summary: Hot and dry, 25-35°C. Great for beach time on the coast. Wildlife viewing still excellent.

seasons.label: Long Rains (Apr-May)
seasons.summary: Heavy rainfall, 18-25°C. Lush green landscapes but some parks may close. Fewer tourists.
